sentences.sContent: He had slumped into a state of torpor from which nothing could rouse him.
sentences.sCn: 他陷入了一种麻木状态，什么事都不能唤起他的兴趣。

sentences.sContent: The sick person gradually falls into a torpor.
sentences.sCn: 这位病人逐渐陷入了萎靡状态中。

remMethod.val: 他真可以说是最 (top) 迟钝的 (torpor) 一个人了

words.tran: 迟钝的，迟缓的；不活泼的；麻痹的；[生物] 蛰伏的
不活泼；麻木；麻痹；无感觉

trans.tranOther: Torpor is the state of being completely inactive mentally or physically, for example, because of illness or laziness
